ABOLISHED.Defintion: formally put an end to (a system, practice, or institution).

ALONG CAME.Defintion: Arrived, used here to emphasis dramatic entry

ARBITRAGING.Defintion: the simultaneous buying and selling of securities, currency, or commodities in different markets or in derivative forms in order to take advantage of differing prices for the same asset.

AUCTIONEER.Defintion: the person or company who is in charge of an auction

AUCTIONING OFF.Defintion: to sell off to the person who says they will pay the most money

BIDDER.Defintion: a person or organization making a formal offer for something, especially at an auction.

CHUNK.Defintion: A large amount or percentage of

CURRENCY MARKETS.Defintion: the markets where people buy and sell different currencies (different types of money)

ENTERPRISING.Defintion: having or showing initiative and resourcefulness.

FREE REIN.Defintion: the freedom to do what they want

INITIATIVES.Defintion: an act or strategy intended to resolve a difficulty or improve a situation; a fresh approach to something.

LOOPHOLE.Defintion: an ambiguity or inadequacy in the law or a set of rules.

LOOPHOLES.Defintion: an ambiguity or inadequacy in the law or a set of rules.

MARKET ECONOMY.Defintion: an economy driven by markets, as exists in a capitalist system. Opposite of a centrally-planned economy

PURGED.Defintion: remove (a group of people considered undesirable) from an organization or place in an abrupt or violent way.

SCANDALOUS.Defintion: causing general public outrage by a perceived offence against morality or law.

SCHEMING.Defintion: make plans, especially in a devious way or with intent to do something illegal or wrong.

SHARE OWNERSHIP.Defintion: the concept that something can be owned by multiple different people

SPECULATE.Defintion: invest in stocks, property, or other ventures in the hope of gain but with the risk of loss.

SPOILS.Defintion: goods stolen or taken forcibly from a person or place, treasure

STOOD.Defintion: to go towards or be destined for

SUBSIDIES.Defintion: a sum of money granted by the state or a public body to help an industry or business keep the price of a commodity or service low.

TENDERS.Defintion: seek offers to carry out work at a stated fixed price

UNCORROBORATED.Defintion: not confirmed or supported by other evidence or information
